intro: Aporuellia guppyi, commonly known as the Guppy's star, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its foliage is often covered in fine hairs, giving it a velvety texture. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
